div.l: Whan þat oure ost had herd þis sermonyng
He gan to speke as lordly as a kyng
He saide what amonteþ alle þis witte
What shal we speke alday of holy writte
The deuel made a Reue for to preche
Or of a Sowter Shipman or a leche
Sey forth þi tale and tarye nought þᵉ tyme
Lo depford and it is halfway pryme
Lo Grenewiche þat mony a shrew is Inne
It were al tyme þi tale for to gynne
Now syres qduod þis Oswold þe Reue
I pray yow alle þat ȝe nouȝt ȝow greue
Þough I vnswere and somdel set his houwe
For leueful it is with force force of shouwe
This dronken meller hath I told vs here
How þat bygiled was a Carpenter
ꝐPar auenture in skorne for I am oon
And be ȝoure leue I shal hym quyte a noon
Right in his Cherlis termes wol I speke
I pray to god his nek mote to breke
He can wel in myn Eye seen a stalke
But in his owen he con not se a balke
Here endith þe prologe of þe Reves tale
And here by gynnyth þe tale
At Trompyngtoıı̄un nouȝt fer fro Canterbery
Ther gooth a broke and ouer þat a brige
Vpon þe wiche broke þer stont a Mille
And this is veray soth þat I ȝow telle
A Miller ther was dwellyng mony a day
As any pecok he was proude and gay
Pypen he couthe ⁊and fisshen ⁊and nettes bete
And torne coppes ⁊and wel wrastel ⁊and shete
Ay be his beld he bare a long panade
And of a sword ful trenchant was þe blade
A Ioly popper bare he in his pouche
Ther was no man for ꝑperil durst hym touche
A sheffeld twhitel bare he in his hose
